newsitem.title: PERU: Venezuela to start issuing T-bills in May - Casas.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela to start issuing T-bills in May - Casas.

text.p: Venezuela's Central Bank expects to start issuing treasury bills on behalf of the government in May to reduce excess liquidity on money markets, Central Bank President Antonio Casas Gonzalez said Wednesday.

"They (the bills) are ready and we hope to start using them next month because we believe it is urgent," Casas told Reuters in an interview during a break from a meeting of central bank officials from the Americas and Spain.

Under a bill currently under study in Congress, the Central Bank will issue up to 450 billion bolivars ($943 million) in treasury bills to meet debt service payments due on a $3.7 billion "mega-bond" with which the government is paying off some of its debts with the Central Bank.
The Central Bank has said the "mega bond" bill is needed to grant it extra flexibility in open market operations to drain excess liquidity.
Currently the bank's weekly monetary stabilization, or TEM, bill auction is the only monetary tool it has to control money supply.
Casas said the bank would use both the TEMs and treasury bills at first to reduce liquidity.
